column4: Hi guys! I am trying to set up an apache2/nginx server behind my router - i have enabled port-forwarding on port 80, and set the server up correctly - i can access it correclty from localhost, but when I go to my IP on the web browser, i am not getting anything - how can I check?
are you using public or private ip address in browser?
i tried both the internal and external ip's
neither worked
you using nginix for load balance or revers proxy?

the one thing I think i could have misconfigured, is the virtualconf file - I don't have a domain name like www.blah.com - i just want to use my ip address, but for servername and serveraliais, i just put bs stuff www.first.com and first.com
reverse proxy - it handles the static content, and passes it through to apache for dyanmic stuff
so why the reverse proxy setup...if its all local?
and what do you have in your apache2 /var/www?
i don't want it all to be local, rather, what i would like to do is be able to go to my ip address, and have a django project set up
but i have apache set up with mod-wsgi for django
so when i do like curl 127.0.0.1 i get some stuff back, but when i go to my ip address, i get nothing
you seen this? https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Django
i checked UFW and made sure that the rule to allow tcp on port 80 is enabled
yah - i've set up this exact server before on a VPS, now i'm trying to set it up in the same way at my house, but for some reason i can't connect to it outside of my router
hhmm...something is looking in the wrong place if you have django setup right...should start from basics
well, i think one of my main problems is the router, and the second problem is maybe something having to do that i'm using a domain name but i don't actually have it registered maybe?
yea instead of names use ip address...i dont have my domain linked to my ip yet so i do all my site editing via ip thru browser
sorta what i just said aint it... =)
if all ip info is good its coming down to the conf files
yea check router setup
i think there are too many hands in this issue...hope ya get it fixed...getting a little crowded! =)
very much so, thanks!
